title: Running Away, and Finding Solace in Art
text:
When George Nkrumah Meizah was growing up in Ghana, he would watch American movies and wonder what it would be like to live in the United States.

“I always wanted to come here,” he said.

Mr. Meizah, 22, was raised by his mother. When he was 2, his father moved to the United States and barely kept in touch. Within a few years, he remarried and started a second family in the Bronx.

Despite their strained relationship, Mr. Meizah’s father offered to help his son emigrate to New York to pursue a better education. When he was 17, Mr. Meizah bade his mother farewell and crossed the Atlantic to move in with his father and stepmother.

Mr. Meizah was excited, but it took him time to adjust. He had trust issues and did not make friends easily in high school. “I study people before I mingle with them,” he said.
description: George Nkrumah Meizah moved to New York from Ghana when he was 17. When he ran into problems at home, he found hope, and purpose, in art therapy.
